entry.content: A Little to the Left | Image: Max Inferno/Secret Mode I just want to keep playing The satisfaction of solving a puzzle is inherent. You learn the rules of the game, then you‚Äôre presented with a challenge that tests your knowledge of those rules. The predictability is calming, and hearing the game‚Äôs click or bell or ring when you‚Äôve solved each puzzle is a serotonin bump I‚Äôve grown a bit reliant upon. But sometimes I can‚Äôt figure out a puzzle, and in those situations, I‚Äôm grateful for games tha...

entry.summary: Photo: Charlie Hall/Polygon After Hasbro‚Äôs crowdfunding effort failed, Renegade Game Studio stepped in to save the reboot Heroscape, the beloved miniatures wargame, is finally back on the market. Po...
entry.content: Photo: Charlie Hall/Polygon After Hasbro‚Äôs crowdfunding effort failed, Renegade Game Studio stepped in to save the reboot Heroscape, the beloved miniatures wargame, is finally back on the market. Polygon had a chance to unbox (but not play) the new Heroscape: Age of Annihilation Master Set and we are delighted to report that even after its rocky reveal in 2022, the reboot looks pretty solid. Better still is the fact that its glorious, chunky terrain will soon be available for everyone to enjoy...

entry.content: One counter to LLMs making up bogus sources or coming up with inaccuracies is retrieval-augmented generation or RAG. Not only can RAG decrease the tendency of LLMs to hallucinate but several other advantages as well.
